metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8912 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel through 4.20.11, af_alg_release() in crypto/af_alg.cneglects to set a NULL value for a certain structure member, which leads toa use-after-free in sockfs_setattr.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8912` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-47-generic - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-4.15.0-47-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-4.15.0-47-lowlatency - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-4.15.0-47-snapdragon - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-47-generic - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-47-lowlatency - 4.15.0-47.50
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1033-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1033.35
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1077.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1035-aws - 4.15.0-1035.37
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-17-generic - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-17-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-17-lowlatency - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-17-snapdragon - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-17-generic - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-17-lowlatency - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-1014-azure - 4.18.0-1014.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1029-gcp - 4.15.0-1029.31
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-kvm - 4.15.0-1031.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1035-oem - 4.15.0-1035.40
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1010-oracle - 4.15.0-1010.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-47.50').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.35').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1077.82').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.37').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-1014.14~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.31').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.31').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.40').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1010.12').
